thread.title: Review: Building ‘The Source’ of America’s Cash Flows and Liquid Assets

author: Gerard Helferich
title: Review: Building ‘The Source’ of America’s Cash Flows and Liquid Assets
text: ‘Why is it,” Martin Doyle asks, “that sewers are often at the cutting edge in finance?” The question isn’t meant as a slur on the financial industry but as testimony to the oversized but underrated role that waterworks have played in the economic annals of the United States. Throughout history, Mr. Doyle argues, our penchant for big-ticket water projects—canals, dams, waste-treatment plants, the wholesale engineering of rivers—has altered the course of public finance and even shifted the balance of power among federal, state and local governments. Instead of “The Source,” his book might have been called “Water and Money.”...
